p: At the city level, we estimated index P in time using daily temperature and humidity data during the period 2005–2013 (from a weather station at the centre of Tegucigalpa, see Data accessibility3). Similarly to what was done for the Brazilian cities (Figure 4), we averaged P over each month across the years. The AaS estimation was performed as in Thézé et al., based on a geopixel located within the geographical boundaries of Tegucigalpa (Thézé et al., 2018). The resulting Tegucigalpa index P was highly correlated with the AaS estimates (Figure 5b).
